title: Baked Fish with Tomato and Harissa
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Baked Fish with Tomato and Harissan a try. This recipe serves 4 and costs $3.49 per serving. One serving contains 334 calories, 37g of protein, and 17g of fat. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. A mixture of garlic, snapper, olive oil, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 1 hour. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 90%. This score is great. Try Baked Falafel Hoagies with Harissa Tomato Sauce and Tzatziki, Tomato-Basil Baked Fish, and Baked King Fish/ Cod in Tomato sauce for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Rabble Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.9 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.

instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Preheat the oven to 400F. Lightly grease a large baking dish. Make three diagonal cuts on each side of the fish through the thickest part of the flesh to ensure even cooking.                                                    Combine the garlic, harissa, and olive oil in a small dish. Put 2 teaspoons of the harissa mixture in the fish cavity and spread the remainder over both sides of the fish, rubbing it into the slits. Place two lemon slices in the cavity of the fish.                                                    Arrange the onion slices in a layer on the baking dish. Top with the tomato slices, thyme, and remaining lemon slices. Place the fish on top and bake, uncovered, for about 2530 minutes, or until the flesh is opaque. Transfer the onion and tomato to a serving dish. Place the fish on top and season with salt.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 400F. Lightly grease a large baking dish. Make three diagonal cuts on each side of the fish through the thickest part of the flesh to ensure even cooking.
Combine the garlic, harissa, and olive oil in a small dish. Put 2 teaspoons of the harissa mixture in the fish cavity and spread the remainder over both sides of the fish, rubbing it into the slits.
Place two lemon slices in the cavity of the fish.
Arrange the onion slices in a layer on the baking dish. Top with the tomato slices, thyme, and remaining lemon slices.
Place the fish on top and bake, uncovered, for about 2530 minutes, or until the flesh is opaque.
Transfer the onion and tomato to a serving dish.
Place the fish on top and season with salt.
